comment_0:
To me, this song is about not being able to make it work with the one person that you love.. 'the one that got away', even.

It accurately shows the entire development of the relationship, from the excitement of first meeting them (we touch i feel a rush.. etc.) - to the fear of being vulnerable with this person (i've been treated like dirt before 'ya).

He accurately describes how people want what they can't have during the development of a relationship (you want them when they don't want you, soon as they do feelings change), but justifies this as he tries to explain that it 'must've been fate':

It's not a contest and I ain't on no conquest for no mate
I wasn't lookin' but I stumbled onto you, must've been fate
But so much is at stake, what the fuck does it take

those defensive lyrics, particularly the first line, highlight his fear of this commitment and sets himself up for disappointment.

It starts with his partner no longer wanting him which breaks his heart and he does anything to fix it. This sudden 'roller coaster' and confusion sets him into a spiral of depression and anger which makes him angry that he can't have her so he tries to kill her in his confused and angry state. He's passionately angry over how much he let himself love her and how much she doesn't care for him. 

In the end, the artist put so much trust and knew what was at stake before putting this trust into the relationship, that when it fucked up, the effects were amplified causing self hatred for trusting this person (before i put this gun to my temple i told you this..) as well as the girl herself. 

This song isn't just about any relationship. It's about that one person you love the most....

Such strong lyrics, Eminem pwns as usual.. best song on the album IMO
comment_1:
My interpretation for the song, taking in consideration also the video, is that everything that is said in the lyrics are just thoughts about getting in an emotional relationship. People, who believe in extreme love but were hurt badly because of this, sometimes take the decision to remain cold all their lives and not show emotions, because if feelings are involved things can get ugly and dangerous. The song is a fight between him and his subconscious for not opening up. The lyrics represent the subconscious, who is reminding him how love is evil. He meets someone new that wakes up his feelings and the subconscious wants to threaten her to stay away, his falling in love and itâs exactly how he thought it will be and he needs her help to end it. He tries to explain himself how much love is in him and how badly itâs going to end if things are moving further. 
The only way he would open up for her is if she will convince him and promise him that itâs not going to hurt him, but nobody can make such commitment and he knows it.   Although he will remain cold because of loveâs nature, he wants to be remembered by her that he exists, their love cannot be saved because itâs too late, someone hurt him badly before and he cannot be the same. He compares himself with a racket ship which can go far into space. She is very close to him, (Earth â Moon) and from all the stars from a clear night sky he aims at her (The Moon). Telling her somehow what sacrifice she is considering his potential, but still, he âaimsâ at her.

There's another song on the album that is "definitely" Kim-oriented, but I think this has to do with a "new found" relationship he has recently experienced. comment_25:
I think this song is 100% about his addiction, and not about a girl at all.

Listen to the words.

The entire opening the second verse is about drugs.

"I do whatever it takes
When I'm with you I get the shakes
My body aches when I ain't
With you I have zero strength
There's no limit on how far I would go
No boundaries, no lengths"

The third verse, the year and six months reference, that's how long he's been clean.

In the first verse, ending it with "You're a supernova" talking about how the feeling while on drugs is like nothing else and it was the bright spot for him in his dark days, but they burn out relatively fast and then it's back to normal, just like the effects of a drug high.

"I wasn't lookin' but I stumbled onto you, must've been fate" Talking about how he never wanted to become hooked on drugs, but through all the tough times and losing Proof it just kinda happened because he needed them at the time to get through.

This song is riddled with drug references the entire way though, first time I heard it I thought it was about addiction. Em is a lyrical genius and he continues to show it on this song and the entire album. Amazing work by Em on Recovery.

comment_44:
The interesting thing about drugs and addiction is that it can often be considered to be, recognized as, or mistaken for a love interest.  In the case of this song, I think it represents a certain love for addiction.  Of course no one truly wants or desires addiction... until it happens.   But, when it actually does happen the addiction is like love. 

I have an ex boy that I dated for many years and we were crazy in love!  He later became addicted to crystal meth.  For me, his struggle with this addiction felt like he was cheating on me.  Although, he never cheated on me with another girl; metaphorically speaking, he was âcheatingâ because thatâs what it felt like.  Later, I decided I wasnât going to compete with his new love interest.  

Anyway, I think thatâs the reason the song is being debated as to what it is actually about.  I think it is about love, addiction, and his love for addiction.  And, I think it is about both drugs and girl(s).  Love can make you shake.  Drugs can make you shake.  Love can give you a rush.  Drugs can give you a rush.  Love can be âevolâ.  Drugs can be evil.  Every lyric in this song can be a reflection of love and a reflection of addiction.  The last verse talks about killing (it)â¦ killing the addiction or killing the girl, which is not uncommon in his music because he âkillsâ a lot in his lyrics.  As someone mentioned above, Shady is an effing lyrical prodigy.  We arenât giving this mastermind enough credit if we think that this (or any of his songs) only represents ONE facet of his life.  Brilliant I say!

comment_49:
This song is about a female fan who fell in love with Eminem and used to write letters to him and he eventually took to liking her but she gave up on him and then he gave up on her (through this song) and it was too late to save their love. It's about Unrequited Love-Love U want but can't have

A year and 6 months is the time Eminem was counting since the last letter she wrote him.

'promise me if i cave in and break and leave myself open that i won't be making a mistake'-she wants him to trust her but also understands what a private person he is and why he won't write back to her because he's afraid she'll go and run her mouth and it'll be all over the media and things will just get chaotic and people will give him a hard time about her, and he's telling her that he's afraid of opening up to her because he's afraid it'll not only wreck what they have/had but it will also cause him to regret opening up to her.

'you want 'em when they don't want u soon as they do feelings change'-people feel so bad for eminem but they regret to think, acknowledge, or know that (maybe) this girl had feelings for eminem to begin with but she didn't feel those feelings were reciprocated/returned, so she let him go, and soon as she did, he started wanting to be with her.

It's not about addiction or kim.

It's not even really about a relationship cause u can hear from the lyrics that their love ended before it really began.

'I wasn't lookin' but I stumbled onto you, must've been fate'-this is about the time he got her letter 


'But a door shuts in your face'-she loved him and told him how she felt but he pushed her away-he 'shut the door in her face'

comment_58: it seems to me that this song has nothing to do with drug addictions. It is actually about an addiction because love is an addiction. "with you I have zero strength" people automatically think drugs but no, if you have ever felt so deeply for someone they almost complete you and you break up you feel like you have no strength. the amazing line "love is evil spell is backwards ill show ya" is just about this very love. love is a paradox because it is evil, but at the same time the complete opposite. Throught the song he goes about how being in love with this unknown person makes him feel so amazing but it also talks about how it can destroy you when things don't work out (hence love is evil). This love is so strong for this person that he goes into saying how he would give up anything, even die for her. He has so much feeling that he would go from complete love and compassion to hate and anger if she leaves.  "I would've did anything for you to show you how much I adored you, but it's over now It's too late to save our love". It seems to me that hes saying he fucked up and he still loves her and wants her back. To summarize this it seems like this is a song about how paradoxal love is, and how strong it is. He obviously screwed up, and he thinks all hope is lost but he just wishes she still thinks about him "Just promise you will think of me every time you look up in the sky and see a star".
comment_59: Yeah me and my girl dated a year and 6 months then she cheated on me with one guy and broke up with me for another
comment_60:
I can't be 100% sure but I really think this is about addiction. Em is describing falling in love with a drug after just a taste, he describes his early fears that the drug will eventually turn on him. This is seen in the first verse. The second verse talks about it being his own fault, he also notes his lack of love for hoes. Drugs have replaced his need for a real life love. 

 "I gotta hole in my heart, I'm some kind of emotional roller coaster
Somethin' I wont go on til you toy with my emotion so it's over
It's like an explosion every time I hold ya
Wasn't jokin' when I told ya
You take my breath away
You're a supernova and I'm a..."

He talks about being an "emotional roller coaster", leaving him vulnerable to drug addiction, which he succumbs to at the end of this verse. 

The third verse describes how he is fully addicted, if you know anything about withdrawal this line rings true.. " I do whatever it takes
When I'm with you I get the shakes
My body aches when I ain't
With you I have zero strength
There's no limit on how far I would go
No boundaries, no lengths" 

Those are powerful words if you've experienced addiction. 

Ok the final verse is where Eminem REALLY gets philosophical and paints a ridiculously genius analogy. As someone noted above ""imma show you what it's like to hurt"?

i didn't know that drugs, which are inanimate, can hurt

"i put both hands on your throat"

you can't kill drugs either "

At first glance/listen it would seem this kills the drug theory. But I believe, after hours of listening, that Eminem is describing the battle between the addicted Eminem and the sobering Eminem. Here's my big theory.... The song appears to be all from Eminem's point of view on someone he loves, but in reality the song is all Eminem talking about and to to sides of himself, rapping from both points of view, that of the addict(or the drug) and the regular Marshall who falls in love with his addiction in turn becoming the addict but still exists underneath the drugs. The last verse is Eminem the drug addict going back and forth with the sobering Eminem, the two are fighting for control over Eminem. Em tries to kill off his addiction/addicted alter ego, while at the same time his addicted side threatens to live on or even kill Em(overdose). In the end, and this is the most telling line in the song. Eminem realizes the only way to destroy his addict side is to kill himself, since they are one in the same. Similar to the end of Fight Club. I know this sounds like a stretch but read these last few lines of the final verse. 

"Ain't no possible reason I could think of to let you walk up out this house
And let you live
Tears streamed down both of my cheeks
Then I let you just go and just give
And before I put that gun to my temple
I told you this"

This is the key! Eminem says he won't let this "you" live, so he lets go, puts the gun to his own head and pulls the trigger. If he had just concluded he shouldn't/can't let this person walk out of the house and live, why would he then NOT KILL THE PERSON and kill himself? Unless of course killing himself guarantees the end of the "person" in questions life, which is the case as the addict and sober Eminem share the same body.

comment_63:
So, in general I feel the song is about a girl, and the drug-like reference is to give a stronger understanding of what exactly this girl meant.
Now in my own interpretation. I feel the girl is someone he just met, but fireworks are going off in him. I think touch signifies more of a brush of hands, arms, etc. And clutch is more like a hug. I feel even after his heart break and closing himself up he figured this was maybe more of a lust but realizing it isn't and he opens himself up to her letting her in, he falls in love, and thought she was too but she wants to be more of a "close friends" situation. He doesn't get why, he found someone he fell in love with when he wasn't looking, so he keeps her around even if it's painful because he has hope but he also did let her in. Then when he finally starts losing feelings for her in that sense, she wants him causing confusion from the denial earlier and him to ask if he should cave or not, but he takes the risk and does because he honestly loves her. The "after a year and six months" makes me think he is talking about the whole time they had known each other not just dated. She basically breaks his heart, he goes off saying he's basically causing her pain like he had warned, but he never did cause her the pain in return and let her go. When he insinuates he kills himself is more of a metaphor to show he basically feels beyond hurt, but he feels taking his own life and his last words basically being i love you no matter will hurt her more than any physical pain he can cause. Just my opinion.

comment_66:
this song is not about being addicted to drugs because he is clearly talking about loving someone and having your heart broken 
this song is also not about kim because of the line "after a year and 6 months" - him and kim was together for ages from when they was teenagers 
this song is also not about mariah because he actually once said in a interview that him and mariah was only together for about 6,7 months 
personally i think that this song may be britney spears or another girl who he had a relationship with
comment_67:
this song is actually about his uncle Ronnie, who, if you don't know, killed himself when Marshall was young because of a bad relationship. but Ronnie was like a father to him. but anyway, it's about a relationship that started out good, but then, feelings started to change, but they never seemed to be on the same page about it. it's about how he loved the girl, told her everything, completely trusted her, but she betrayed him in one form or another. and he becomes so emotional over it, that he kills her and ultimately ends up killing himself as well.

(btw, the video for this song is amazing, sad, but amazing)

comment_70: This is another song about murder from Eminem. They all have the same theme of murder or suicide but they're all different in their own ways. (e.g. Stan, Love the Way You Lie, Space Bound) It's about a hoe trying to leave Eminem, but he's in love so he snaps and threathens to kill her. Then, he realises he loves her and can't, so shoots himself instead.
comment_71:
When I watch the video I get an entirely different view- I believe that he is in Hell forced to relive his suicide and the events leading up to it.  In the beginning it shows the wolf-  a pack animal but here alone.  When he is on the road there is a bright light at the end (light at the end of the tunnel).   When they are in the diner they don't eat or drink.  When he opens the door to the motel his G-shock is blank- "tic toc" (REM) ran out of time.  The "alter ego" stays in the diner and does not go into the motel- he knows what is going to happen and does not want to relive it.  After he kills himself it starts all over again- kind of a Twilight Zone/Groundhog day.
"Nobody knows me I'm cold"  "It's no one's fault but my own"  "I told you you take my breath away" "Its the path I've chosen to go  Frozen as snow"  "I'm a space bound rocket ship"- I've left this world promise to remember me when you look at the night sky.
comment_72: This song is about a man who kills himself because the woman he loved, has left him. /wikipedia/
comment_73:
this song perfectly describes the corrupted nature of modern relationships ,it contains 3 parts and after each one you hear the beautiful chores:
1)Introduction: it describes the beginning of his relationship; he is suspicious and f**ked up because of his last unsuccessful relationships and describes why he is the way he is and why itâs so hard for him to trust her. He has two characters in this part, it, maybe it is because one is playing the role and the other one should sing, but I think it shows how he is trying to cover his real self(the person in the back sit who is angry and canât trust the girl) and part of him( the angry f**ked up part) tries to keep his distance and not get involved.
2)Relationship: itâs the best part and each word of it is gold, he describes his deep emotions toward her, he complains about the f**ked up chase that exist in the beginning of any relationship and how we canât show our love to others without fearing that it might blow the whole thing, itâs like you have to be unreachable to be desirable and this is a messed up game that people play, this part is amazing, in the end he asks her to make a promise(obviously in his mind) however he knows she is gonna screw him, but anyway he talks himself in and trust her.  
3)The end: she leaves him, after all that he has been through and finally found the strength to trust her, she Is going and after disappointing efforts for stopping her, he gives up and let her go resulting him to die inside(or killing himself which is not different from being dead inside from his point of view)
and finally there is the bitter ending, the lyrics after the shooting which is his last words to the girl which describes his lost but also true love for the girl. The genius part is that when he kills himself not only the exterior part of him dies but also the very core part of his being which is the person who wanted to keep his distance and was left in the cafÃÂ© also dies.
to sum up the song is about reoccurring event in his life: liking someone, getting close to her while you are feared of what is coming and finally giving up and loving her and being left alone
this song is simply perfect

comment_78: This song shows my favorite side of Eminem. The side that makes him famous. I think he's talking about his relationship with Kim. When he says "When I put my gun to my temple" I think it's a revealing that he thought of killing himself. I think this is his true feelings for Kim. At the end he's saying that although he couldn't work it out, he's still there for her and there's a place in his heart for her.

comment_82:
This one rings close. Once upon a woman, she reached out to my core and I gave in when I am not the kind of person to be alright with the very notion of companionship. So I went in ahead, in spite of my better sense, and fell hard.

Fell so hard.

Eventually, she grew tired of me, since I was not "the same person" I was when we started going out. Not sure if that's true, cause I merely opened myself to her like I never have before. She showed me her faults and I accepted her, and when I did the same, she did not. Whatever, I was long fixated on her even when it was all over. I ached everyday, I hated every minute apart from her... and I became obsessed. I fucked up every time afterwards when we'd communicate.

I won't deny my fault, cause I had great part of it, but she threw me away when I needed her the most. 

Now adays, she matters little to me, or rather, if I feel something, it is mere animosity. I am a much more balanced person now. But this song will always remind me of that relationship, years ago.
comment_83:
This song is incomparable owing to em's ingenious hard-hitting verses which is a perfect example of an extra-strong emotional experience. Most of my interpretation involves expanding the cues into a contextual narrative, the implied human experience and the unfavourable environment of the current day love-affairs which is frightening, in general. Extremely touching because of its relatable ideas like possessiveness, victimhood, abuse, compulsive thinking, social frustration, loss anxiety, self-limiting cycles of insecurity, passion, undisclosed longing and bewilderment. It serves to tell that one should love more honestly. Shows that people with a broken heart need a solid assurance to believe in love again. 

Gist: Space Bound has a fantastical touch with a space metaphor in the hook, implying that the harsh circumstances between the could-be-lovers as a game of cosmic fate. 


...its torturous: He's passionate, maybe even in excess of what this situation can allow at maximum. An overwhelming deal of emotional rush that he just cannot share with her, drives him into a chain of destructive thoughts. All such confusions mentioned in the song adds to his self-pity

....just did the impossible: He considers this woman special for an additional reason. She showed him a picture so compelling that he faces his "desire to be loved" like when it was his first time. A fact so wild, he becomes childish which is most likely  unwelcomed and mispercieved. That is why at one juncture in this story he tries to hide his intense need when he says;  "I ain't on no conquest for no mate." Her image in his mind unearths his past supression for ideal love. He probes across the difficulties, complexities and the few outcomes of his undisciplined imagination. 

Gained my trust...: He is extraordinarily aware of his lover's recklessness and her indifferent nature. He gets this hint from how she behaves with him or meddles with his emotions. She is definitely showing him a tough time. He sort of knows that she has misused her feminine charm.

Cause if I get burnt....: He posesses a violent tendency to react in situations he can't reason with. Hardly a warning, this is a threat because he has a bitter suspicion that she will resort to mistreatment and manipulation to get it her way and it should be done away with completely if she wants to feel his genuine love. Upon overthinking toxic signs he feels the need to defend himself.

Nobody knows me I'm cold: He has not recieved his fair share of love in this life. He  has passed through a phase of self judgement in which he concluded that his need for love eventually destroys his self-esteem and then his unkind reactions distances his lover only to fuel the problems more than ever. He is cold now that the totality of his efforts to experience love has led to his own psychological disintegration.

Its the path I've chosen:  as obvious as it is, everyone has struggles above the ones they face in intimate relationships. Those other struggles require him to be the self he is. This self isn't full of traits that exactly lead to a healthy relation. Life so far has added up to the unlovable persona he has today. With this he also reveals he is very hurt by his troubles already and would like it if she deals with him keeping this unfair reality of his life in her mind. 

...hole in my heart for some kind of emotional rollercoaster: he's content with the idea of necessary sacrifices and unconditional compromise because he's learnt its value but somehow always sets himself up for chaos by giving in to the tsunami of uncontrolled sentiments. 

Two hundred fifty thousand miles...And I'm aiming right at you: he knows the pain it would cause him do cover the harsh path before they can be together peacefully. The fact that he knows it and still takes up the challenge makes him perfect in every dimension. This is the value he brings to their relationship which needs to be acknowledged by her even if she doesn't love him back with the same intensity. 

My body aches when I ain't: This woman, is to him, what home means to a wanderer. The wanderer never had a chance to settle down because he wanted the right place to belong to. Wandering here means carrying on with life without a lasting personal meaning. He feels they are fated to be together inspite of multitudes of differences. Her presence is a deeply moving experience for him. She is her single chance at being complete. 

With you I have zero strength: he doesn't want to be vulnerable in front of a person who cannot be trusted for a consistent emotional exchanges. In the later stages of a relationship, often, the other misuses his emotional surrender to their interest. It's a blood boiling fact about one's self; this is the only place in the world where he feels torn to death when something goes wrong. It's tragic, he can't properly live with her but without her he doesn't feel alive. 

*Incomplete*
comment_84: The song is about Kim, eminem and kim were married in June 1999 and divorced 12 months later in August 2000 making it 14 months, then they remarried for 2 months and divorced again, making it 1 year and six months in total.
